entry.title: Off the Beaten Path
entry.content:
Off the Beaten Path

El Cuyo

entry.title: Destination of the Month
entry.content:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

entry.title: Alexander Sabar
entry.content: ... that Alexander Sabar feared thesis defense more than terrorists?

entry.title: Trinity Communion Church
entry.content: ... that Trinity Communion Church in New York erected a 10-foot (3.0 m) papier-mâché pink elephant on its lawn to increase its visibility in its neighborhood?

entry.title: Bea Sprung
entry.content: ... that Bea Sprung credits her competitive swimming background with aiding her development as a footballer?

entry.title: Music for the Masses
entry.content: ... that Depeche Mode chose to follow a set of rules, including one against using chords, when they recorded their 1987 album Music for the Masses?

entry.title: Tilly Norwood
entry.content: ... that the AI creation Tilly Norwood has been described as "really, really scary"?

entry.title: Otago Farmers Market
entry.content: ... that Otago Farmers Market celebrated its birthday with a "long lunch" on a railway platform?

entry.title: a retired manufacturing CEO
entry.content: ... that a retired manufacturing CEO and a former Muppeteer co-produced a biopic of Dietrich Bonhoeffer?

entry.title: 141 Schools for Peace
entry.content: ... that the 141 Schools for Peace campaign was formed in the aftermath of the 2014 Peshawar school massacre and received proceeds from "We Will Fly"?

entry.title: Truganini
entry.content: ... that, upon the death of Truganini (pictured), the Aboriginal population of Tasmania was declared to be extinct?
